alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Meigs (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 2:50PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT RHEA...NORTHEASTERN MEIGS AND NORTHEASTERN BLEDSOE COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/... At 350 PM EDT/250 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dayton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Spring City, Evensville, Peakland, Stinging Fork Falls State Park, Old Washington, Grandview, and Piney Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
